solution_line_template: Nurse Missy has {total_patients}*({special_fraction})=<<{total_patients}*({special_fraction})={special_patients}>>{special_patients} special needs patients.
Special needs patients take {percent_longer*100}% longer to serve, which means serving takes (1+{percent_longer})*{standard_time}={special_time} minutes per patient.
To serve dinner to all of her standard care patients, it will take {standard_time}*{standard_patients}=<<{standard_time}*{standard_patients}={standard_total_time}>>{standard_total_time} minutes.
To serve dinner to all of her special needs patients, it will take {special_time}*{special_patients}=<<{special_time}*{special_patients}={special_total_time}>>{special_total_time} minutes.
In total, it will take {standard_total_time}+{special_total_time}=<<{standard_total_time}+{special_total_time}={total_time}>>{total_time} minutes to serve dinner to all of her patients.
